IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: VENTURE FOR AMERICA IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT IS CREATING ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY IN AMERICAN CITIES BY MOBILIZING THE NEXT GENERATION OF ENTREPRENEURS AND EQUIPPING THEM WITH THE SKILLS AND RESOURCES THEY NEED TO CREATE JOBS. THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES A 2-YEAR FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM THAT RECRUITS, TRAINS, AND INVESTS IN TOP RECENT COLLEGE GRADUATES BY PLACING THEM IN STARTUPS IN AMERICAN CITIES WITH EMERGING ENTREPRENEURSHIP ECOSYSTEMS AND HELPING THEM LAUNCH THEIR OWN HIGH-IMPACT BUSINESSES. VFA OPERATES A FOUR-WEEK TRAINING CAMP FOR INCOMING FELLOWS, PROVIDES ONGOING PROGRAMMING DURING THE 2 YEAR FELLOWSHIP, AND OPERATES AN ACCELERATOR FOR PROGRAM GRADUATES WHO ARE STARTING THEIR OWN BUSINESSES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: VENTURE FOR AMERICA IS CREATING ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY IN AMERICAN CITIES BY MOBILIZING THE NEXT GENERATION OF ENTREPRENEURS AND EQUIPPING THEM WITH THE SKILLS AND RESOURCES THEY NEED TO CREATE JOBS.
IRS990.Desc: ACCELERATOR: THE VENTURE FOR AMERICA ACCELERATOR GIVES VFA ALUMNI THE TIME, SPACE, AND SUPPORT THEY NEED TO TURN THEIR SIDE PROJECTS AND BUSINESS CONCEPTS INTO FULL-TIME VENTURES. THE PROGRAM IS A 4-MONTH, VIRTUAL ACCELERATOR. VFA PROVIDES BOTH LIVING AND BUSINESS STIPENDS AND TAKES NO EQUITY IN THE COMPANIES. OUR 6TH ANNUAL ACCELERATOR TOOK PLACE VIRTUALLY FROM AUGUST 10 TO NOVEMBER 20, 2020. THE ACCELERATOR FOLLOWS A CURRICULUM THAT INCLUDES TRAINING, WORKSHOPS, AND MENTORING BY THE VFA TEAM, VFA FELLOW FOUNDER ALUMNI, AND NATIONAL SUPPORTERS. SEVEN COMPANIES PARTICIPATED IN THE 2020 ACCELERATOR COHORT, WHICH CULMINATED IN OUR ANNUAL DEMO DAY IN WHICH ACCELERATOR PARTICIPANTS COMPETED FOR $10,000 IN GRANT FINANCING, SPONSORED BY UBS.TRAINING CAMP:THE VENTURE FOR AMERICA FELLOWSHIP KICKS OFF WITH TRAINING CAMP, A HALLMARK OF OUR PROGRAM AND OUR PRIMARY EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVE. FOR ONE MONTH, INCOMING FELLOWS WORK TOGETHER VIRTUALLY, LEARNING A COMBINATION OF BOTH HARD AND SOFT SKILLS CRITICAL TO A SUCCESSFUL CAREER IN STARTUPS. MORE THAN A SERIES OF LECTURES AND WORKSHOPS, TRAINING CAMP IS WHAT SETS VFA APART AND WHAT MAKES OUR PROGRAM A TRUE FELLOWSHIP A COMMUNITY OF LIKE MINDED INDIVIDUALS UNITED BY A SHARED GOAL AND BONDED IN FRIENDSHIP AND CAMARADERIE.TRAINING CAMP 2020 WAS OUR FIRST VIRTUAL TRAINING CAMP. DURING ONE MONTH ON ZOOM (146 SESSIONS), VFA HOSTED A COMBINED 370+ PEOPLE FROM ACROSS THE COUNTRY AS PART OF OUR HALLMARK NATIONAL PROGRAM. BECAUSE OF OUR PROGRAM, 212 FELLOWS, 14 TCR TEAM MEMBERS (3 FT VFA, 6 ALUMNI AND 5 INTERNS), MADE ZOOM AND REMO THEIR HOME FOR THE SUMMER. ADDITIONALLY, 71+ SPEAKERS, TRAINERS, AND GUESTS FROM OUT OF TOWN AND 25 VFA TEAM MEMBERS PARTICIPATED AND IMPACTED OUR NATIONAL PROGRAM.RECRUITMENT AND DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSIONIN 2019 WE BEGAN OPERATION 3 TO 300, OUR COMMITMENT TO HELP 300 WOMEN AND RACIAL AND ETHNIC MINORITIES BECOME ENTREPRENEURS IN THE NEXT THREE YEARS. THROUGHOUT 2020, VFA CONTINUED TO PARTNER WITH CHAMPION SUPPORTERS WITH DEEP KNOWLEDGE OF THE STARTUP AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP LANDSCAPE AND A COMMITMENT TO BUILDING AND MAINTAINING DIVERSITY, EQUITY AND INCLUSION IN THESE AREAS AND VFA AS AN ORGANIZATION. ONE RESULT IS THAT THE VFA CLASS OF 2020 WAS THE LARGEST AND MOST DIVERSE CLASS TO-DATE. OF THE 213 FELLOWS WHO COMMENCED THE FELLOWSHIP IN JULY, 2020, 53% IDENTIFY AS WOMEN OR GENDER NON-CONFORMING INDIVIDUALS, AND 53% IDENTIFY AS RACIAL OR ETHNIC MINORITIES. WE ACHIEVED THIS DIVERSITY BY EXECUTING STRATEGIC RECRUITMENT EFFORTS TO DIVERSIFY OUR APPLICANT POOL. OUR RECRUITMENT STRATEGY (WHICH BEGINS IN THE SUMMER AND CONTINUES THROUGHOUT THE ACADEMIC YEAR IN TANDEM WITH OUR SELECTION PROCESS) HAS CHANGED IN THE PAST THREE SEASONS TO INCLUDE A WIDER RANGE OF SCHOOLS AND A MORE DIVERSE POOL OF CANDIDATES. OUR CURRENT RECRUITMENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE TARGETING MORE SCHOOLS IN AND NEAR VFA CITIES (WITH THE HOPE THAT RECRUITING FELLOWS WHOSE HOMETOWNS ARE CLOSE TO VFA CITIES WILL LEAD TO INCREASED RETENTION), RECRUITING CANDIDATES FROM HBCUS (WITH 9 HBCU GRADUATES IN OUR 2020 CLASS - OUR LARGEST EVER) AND SCHOOLS IN PREDOMINANTLY LATINX CITIES, FOCUSING ON STEAM PROGRAMS, AND CONNECTING WITH ENTREPRENEURIAL-SUPPORTING ORGANIZATIONS AND CHAPTERS AT THE UNIVERSITIES AT WHICH WE RECRUIT. WE CONTINUED TO DEEPEN EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS WITH DIVERSE RECRUITMENT ORGANIZATIONS LIKE JOPWELL, PREP FOR PREP, AND HBCU 20X20 AND INCREASE OUR CAMPUS-TARGETER PRESENCE AT HISTORICALLY BLACK COLLEGES AND HISPANIC-SERVING INSTITUTIONS. IN JULY 2020, WE COMPLETED AN INSIGHTFUL FOUR-MONTH AUDIT TO ANALYZE AND IMPROVE VFA'S DEI PRACTICES WITH YARDSTICK MANAGEMENT, A CONSULTING FIRM THAT SPECIALIZES IN THIS WORK, SO OUR ACTIONS AND WORDS BEST MEET OUR INTENTIONS. BY WORKING WITH YARDSTICK, WE WERE GIVEN AN OBJECTIVE VIEW OF OUR WORK AND VERY DIRECT GOALS AND RECOMMENDATIONS TO GROW IN THIS AREA. THIS WORK CULMINATED IN A REPORT HIGHLIGHTING VFA'S SHORT AND LONG-TERM OPPORTUNITIES FOR GROWTH IN EACH OF OUR DEPARTMENTS. IN ADDITION, THE VFA TEAM RECEIVED A LIST OF REQUESTS AND RECOMMENDATIONS FROM VFA RISE GROUP (AFFINITY) LEADS ON HOW WE CAN BETTER SUPPORT COMMUNITIES OF COLOR AND IN PARTICULAR STAND IN SOLIDARITY WITH THE MOVEMENT FOR BLACK LIVES. THE RENEWED AND FOCUSED COMMITMENT FROM OUR FELLOWS AND ALUMNI TO ENSURE AN EVEN DEEPER AND MORE THOROUGH LOOK AT OUR DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION PRACTICES HIGHLIGHTED EVEN MORE THAT WE CAN AND SHOULD BE DOING TO SUPPORT AND REQUEST EQUITABLE POLICIES OF OURSELVES, COMPANIES, AND PARTNERS. MEMBERS OF THE VFA TEAM WORKED TO COMBINE THE RECOMMENDATIONS FROM YARDSTICK AND RISE LEADS INTO A SINGLE STRATEGIC DEI IMPLEMENTATION PLAN THAT WAS FINALIZED AND SHARED WITH OUR BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND FELLOW COMMUNITY IN EARLY AUGUST 2020.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S ACCOUNTING POLICY IS TO PROVIDE LIABILITIES FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS WHEN A LIABILITY IS PROBABLE AND ESTIMABLE. MANAGEMENT IS NOT AWARE OF ANY VIOLATION OF ITS TAX STATUS AS AN ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES, NOR OF ANY EXPOSURE TO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART I, LINE 2 - PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VENTURE FOR AMERICA REQUESTS PERIODIC NARRATIVE AND FINANCIAL REPORTING OF GRANT FUNDED ACTIVITIES FROM GRANTEES. GRANT EXPENDITURES ARE ACCOUNTED FOR UNDER THE ACCRUAL METHOD.

TRAVEL EXPENSES DECREASED $460 FROM $83,071 TO $82,611. THIS CHANGE IMPACTED THE PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES, TOTAL FUNCTIONAL EXPENSES, AND TOTAL NET ASSETS AT THE END OF THE YEAR. THIS $460 CHANGE IS NOW REFLECTED IN THE AMENDED RETURN ON THE FOLLOWING PARTS: PART III LINE 4E PART IX LINES 25A, 25B, 25C, 25D PART XI LINE 2 SCHEDULE D, PART XII LINE 1 AND LINE 3

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PRIOR TO FILING OF THE RETURN, THE 990 IS DISTRIBUTED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR THEIR APPROVAL. THE 990 IS THEN FORWARDED TO THE FULL BOARD FOR THEIR REVIEW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS PRESENTED FOR SIGNATURE TO BOARD MEMBERS ANNUALY. EACH BOARD MEMBER SIGNS AN ANNUAL DECLARATION STATING THAT THEY HAD NO CONFLICTS OR IDENTIFYING THE NATURE OF THEIR CONFLICTED TRANSACTIONS. SHOULD THERE BE ANY NEED TO REVIEW POTENTIAL CONFLICTS, THE BOARD PRESIDENT WILL DETERMINE HOW TO ADDRESS AND TAKE APPROPRIATE ACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, COMPRISED OF THREE BOARD MEMBERS, REVIEWS AND CREATES RECOMMENDATIONS ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION BASED ON COMPARABLE STUDIES OF RECOGNIZED INDUSTRY COMPENSATION SURVEYS. MINUTES OF THE COMMITTEE REFLECT THE NATURE OF THIS PROCESS. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE RECOMMENDATIONS ARE PRESENTED TO THE FULL BOARD FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. THE BOARD APPROVES THE ANNUAL ORGANIZATIONAL BUDGET WHICH INCLUDES COMPENSATION DETAIL OF ALL OTHER OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WILL BE POSTED ON OUR WEBSITE AND IT IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. ALL OTHER DOCUMENTS, SUCH AS PREVIOUS FORMS 990 AND ANNUAL REPORTS, ARE ALSO PUBLISHED ON OUR WEBSITE AT: HTTPS://VENTUREFORAMERICA.ORG/FINANCIALS/
OTHER PROFESSIONAL FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 324,538. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 12,412. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 44,741. TOTAL EXPENSES 381,691.

MEALS: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 26,349. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 291. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 859. TOTAL EXPENSES 27,499. TELEPHONE & INTERNET: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 5,760. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 1,237. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 1,855. TOTAL EXPENSES 8,852. SHIPPING: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 1,201. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 28. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 156. TOTAL EXPENSES 1,385.
CHANGE TO PRIOR YEAR NET ASSETS -541,183.

AMOUNTS PRESENTED ON THIS RETURN FOR YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31,2020 HAVE BEEN RECLASSIFIED AND RESTATED TO CONFORM TO THE CURRENT PRESENTATION FOR NET ASSETS WITH AND WITHOUT DONOR RESTRICTIONS. RESTATEMENTS INCLUDE ADJUSTMENTS TO DEFERRED REVENUE, INVESTMENTS, AND PLEDGES RECEIVABLE. IN ORDER TO CONFORM TO THESE CHANGES, THERE IS AN AMOUNT ON LINE 9 TO REFLECT A PRIOR PERIOD ADJUSTMENT. THIS ADJUSTMENT RECONCILES THE BEGINNING BALANCE OF NET ASSETS TO TIE TO THE 2021 FINANCIAL STATEMENTS., DECREASING THE BEGINNING BALANCE OF NET ASSETS BY 541,183.

THE CHANGE IN PLEDGES RECEIVABLE REFLECTS THE REMOVAL OF AN UNIDENTIFIABLE EVERGREEN PLEDGE MADE PRIOR TO 2020. PLEDGES RECEIVABLE HAS NOW BEEN RESTATED TO 145,421, RESULTING IN A 202,467 DECREASE TO THE PREVIOUSLY STATED ASSET.
INVESTMENTS HAVE BEEN RESTATED TO REFLECT THE PROPER VALUATION OF BANZA LLC. THE ORIGINALLY STATED INVESTMENT HAS DECREASED BY 400,716, RESULTING IN A FINAL VALUATION OF (5,512).

THERE HAS BEEN AN ADJUSTMENT TO A DEFERRED REVENUE FROM 2019, WHICH HAS RESULTED IN A RESTATEMENT TO OTHER LIABILITIES ON THE BALANCE SHEET. OTHER LIABILITIES HAS DECREASED BY 62,000 DUE TO THIS CHANGE.
